org.eclipse.nvplayout.controller

Class CalibrationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.nvplayout.controller.CalibrationController

  • public class CalibrationController
extends java.lang.Object
    CalibrationController is the controller to manage the calibration part modification.

    Based on a MVC model

    Version:
    0.0 Alpha EarlyAccess Beta Tester
    Author:
    GLI feat Software Team
    See Also:
    Calibration

      • CalibrationController

        public CalibrationController(long lStartAdress)
        Create the global structure of the calibration memory, update the structure with the file calibration.xml
        Parameters:
        lStartAdress - long : Set the start address of the calibration zone memory
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • addBlock

        public void addBlock()
        Instance a new empty memory block in the calibration configuration. Update Active block and block address for homogeneity.
        See Also:
        Calibration.addBlock()

      • addVariable

        public void addVariable()
        Instance a new empty Variable in the current active block of the calibration configuration. Update block address and variable for homogeneity. Add a security if there is no block available.
        See Also:
        Calibration.addVariable(int)

      • setData

        public boolean setData(int variable,
                       int info,
                       java.lang.String data)
        Update one data of one variable of the active block.
        Parameters:
        variable - Int : The ID of the variable, for which we send the ask to modify one data of it
        info - Int : The data ask for modification
        data - String : Value for the update
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the modification are set, false if not
        See Also:
        setAliasInRam(int, java.lang.String), setValue(int, java.lang.String), setTypeOfVariable(int, java.lang.String), setUnit(int, java.lang.String), setDescription(int, java.lang.String), setLowRange(int, java.lang.String), setHighRange(int, java.lang.String), setRequirement(int, java.lang.String)

        Int : Return the active block

        public void setActiveBlock(int iActiveBlock)
        Set a new active block, this correspond to the block where all modification are made.
        Parameters:

      • exportData

        public boolean exportData()
        Export the data present in local calibration model to the Calibration.xml file.
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the xml file were successfully write, false if not
        See Also:

      • importData

        public void importData()
        Import the data from the Calibration.xml file to the local calibration model.
        See Also:
        readXML(org.w3c.dom.Node), Calibration.delallBlock(), SimpleErrorHandler

      • generatefile

        public boolean generatefile()
        Launch the script which generate all the file linked to the calibration, see S:\Components\Application\NVP\Scripts\generateCalibration.bat.
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the batch script is well launch, false if not

      • getheaderVariable

        public java.lang.String[] getheaderVariable()

        Returns:
        String[] : Array of string containing the name of column.
        See Also:

      • getAllVariable

        public java.lang.String[][] getAllVariable()
        Return the double array containing all the data of all the variable, of the current active block. Variable in row and data in column.
        Returns:
        String[][] : Double array of string containing all the information.
        See Also:
        Calibration.getAllVariable(int)

      • getallblock

        public java.lang.String[][] getallblock()
        Return the double array containing all the data of all block. Block in row and data of each block in column.
        Returns:
        String[][] : Double array of string containing all the information.
        See Also:
        Calibration.getallblock()

      • setDataDisplay

        public void setDataDisplay(int iDisplay)
        Modify the format of how the variable is display. hexadecimal = 0, decimal = 1.
        Parameters:
        iDisplay - Int : New format wanted.
        See Also:
        Calibration.setDisplay(int)

      • deleteBlock

        public boolean deleteBlock()
        Delete the current active block, prompt a dialog to confirm the delete.
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the modification are set, false if not
        See Also:
        Calibration.getnbBlock(), Calibration.delBlock(int), Calibration.block, updateAddressBlock(), updateAddressVariable(int), updateAddressBlock()

      • deletevariable

        public boolean deletevariable(int iVariable)
        Delete a variable of the current active block, prompt a dialog to confirm the delete.
        Parameters:
        iVariable - Int : The ID of the variable, needed to be delete in the current active block.
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the modification are set, false if not
        See Also:
        Calibration.getNbVariable(int), Calibration.delVariable(int, int), Calibration.getAllVariable(int), Calibration.getnbBlock(), updateAddressVariable(int), updateAddressBlock()

      • upBlock

        public void upBlock()
        If possible, up the active block in local memory.
        See Also:
        Calibration.getnbBlock(), Calibration.upBlock(int), updateAddressBlock(), updateIDBlock()

      • downBlock

        public void downBlock()
        If possible, down the active block in local memory.
        See Also:
        Calibration.getnbBlock(), Calibration.downBlock(int), updateAddressBlock(), updateIDBlock()

      • upVariable

        public void upVariable(int iVariable)
        If possible, up the selected variable in the current active block in local memory.
        Parameters:
        iVariable - Int : selected variable wanted to be up in the block
        See Also:
        Calibration.getnbBlock(), Calibration.upVariable(int, int), updateAddressVariable(int)

      • downVariable

        public void downVariable(int iVariable)
        If possible, up the selected variable in the current active block in local memory.
        Parameters:
        iVariable - Int : selected variable wanted to be down in the block
        See Also:
        Calibration.getnbBlock(), Calibration.downVariable(int, int), updateAddressVariable(int)

      • setStartAddress

        public void setStartAddress(java.lang.String sStartAddress)
        Set the start address of the calibration memory's zone. Doesn't set the new address if the format it's not known
        Parameters:
        sStartAddress - String : Start address express in hexadecimal (with 0x) or decimal.
        See Also:
        updateAddressBlock(), updateAddressVariable(int), Calibration.setStartAddress(long), Calibration.getnbBlock()

      • readXML

        private void readXML(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
        Recursive function use to parse all the tag of the Calibration.xml file. And set the data information in the local data base.
        Parameters:
        n - Node : The node contain all the information of there children; the first call need to be the root node of the Calibration.xml file.
        See Also:
        Calibration.getnbBlock(), Calibration.addBlock(), Calibration.setSizeOfBlock(int), Calibration.setNameOfBlock(int, java.lang.String), Calibration.setAddressOfBlock(int, long), Calibration.setID(int, int), Calibration.addVariable(int), Calibration.setAliasInRAM(int, int, java.lang.String), Calibration.getNbVariable(int), Calibration.setAddressOfVariable(int, int, long), Calibration.setValue(int, int, long), Calibration.setTypeOfVariable(int, int, java.lang.String), Calibration.setUnit(int, int, java.lang.String), Calibration.setDescription(int, int, java.lang.String), Calibration.setLowRange(int, int, long), Calibration.setHighRange(int, int, long), Calibration.setRequirement(int, int, java.lang.String)

      • writeXML

        private boolean writeXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
        Construct the xml tree for Calibration.xml.
        Parameters:
        doc - Document : The xml tree, need to be empty at function call
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the document are well generate, false if not
        See Also:
        Calibration.getnbBlock(), Calibration.getNbVariable(int), Calibration.getNameOfBlock(int), Calibration.getID(int), Calibration.getAddressOfBlock(int), Calibration.getNbVariable(int), Calibration.getSizeOfBlock(int), Calibration.getAliasInRAM(int, int), Calibration.getAddressOfVariable(int, int), Calibration.getTypeOfVariable(int, int), Calibration.getSizeOfVariable(int, int), Calibration.getUnit(int, int), Calibration.getDescription(int, int), Calibration.getLowRange(int, int), Calibration.getHighRange(int, int), Calibration.getRequirement(int, int)

      • updateAddressBlock

        private void updateAddressBlock()
        Update the address of all block, calculating in relation with the block size.
        See Also:
        Calibration.getnbBlock(), Calibration.setSizeOfBlock(int), Calibration.setAddressOfBlock(int, long), Calibration.getStartAddress(), memoryWholenumber(int)

      • updateAddressVariable

        private void updateAddressVariable(int blockid)
        Update all the address of the different variable in a selected block.
        Parameters:
        blockid - Int : The ID of the block where address of the different variable need to be update.
        See Also:
        Calibration.getNbVariable(int), Calibration.setAddressOfVariable(int, int, long), Calibration.getAddressOfBlock(int), Calibration.getSizeOfVariable(int, int)

      • updateIDBlock

        private void updateIDBlock()
        Update The ID of the different block according the order in local memory.
        See Also:
        Calibration.getnbBlock(), Calibration.setID(int, int)

      • memoryWholenumber

        private int memoryWholenumber(int nb)
        Set the difference with the fourth divisor complement. Needed to align the start adress of different memory block.
        Parameters:
        nb - Int : The number which one we search the difference with the fourth complement
        Returns:
        Int : return the additional number to 4 divisor
        See Also:
        setAliasInRam(int, java.lang.String)

      • setAliasInRam

        private boolean setAliasInRam(int variable,
                              java.lang.String data)
        Update AliasInRam of one variable of the active block.
        Parameters:
        variable - Int : The ID of the variable, for which we want to change a data
        data - String : The new data to update
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the modification are set, false if not
        See Also:
        Calibration.getAliasInRAM(int, int), Calibration.setAliasInRAM(int, int, java.lang.String)

      • setValue

        private boolean setValue(int variable,
                         java.lang.String data)
        Update Value of one variable of the active block. Check the format and don't write if not recognize.
        Parameters:
        variable - Int : The ID of the variable, for which we want to change a data
        data - String : The new data to update
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the modification are set, false if not
